creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: three-case inrō; gold and red takamaki-e and hiramaki-e inlay in Shibayama style; mother-of-pearl inlay; two rectangular panels; on one side is scene of man eating, another man pouring tea; turtle in foreground; flowering plant behind; on reverse side is scene of 2 birds in flowering tree; borders of flowerheads and scrolling foliage; ivory manju netsuke; painted with gold bird; mother-of-pearl floral border; flower centered on bottom; netsuke on gold cord; ivory bead ojime; peacock painted in gold with mother-of-pearl inlay; attached with braided cord
medium: Lacquer (takamaki-e, hiramaki-e), gold, mother-of-pearl; ojime: ivory; netsuke: ivory; silk cord
title: Three-case inro with birds on tree
